questions.question_text:
Your company purchases 20 laptops that use a new hardware platform.
In a test environment, you deploy Windows 10 to the new laptops.
Some laptops frequently generate stop errors.
You need to identify the cause of the issue.
What should you use?

discussion.content: A is Correct
A is correct . Reliability Monitor is the offical MS tool to identify Hardware issues.
https://winbuzzer.com/2021/06/03/windows-10-how-to-use-reliability-monitor-to-analyze-system-crashes-and-freezes-xcxwbt/

A. Reliability Monitor

https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/ask-the-performance-team/using-reliability-monitor-for-troubleshooting/ba-p/372962
E. Event viewer
You have no servers... so you can't use Config Manager or WSUS.
A previous version of answers was WSUS, GPO and BranchCache and all the contributors was contesting. Now, the answers are good.

This question is interesting because it deals with the essence of the SaaS market standard. Specifically here as a servicing tool that manages Windows as a service.

All the answers are correct.

Windows Update for Business includes control over update deferment and provides centralized management using Group Policy or MDM (Microsoft Intune). Windows Update for Business can be used to defer updates by up to 365 days, depending on the version. These deployment options are available to clients in the General Availability Channel. In addition to being able to use Group Policy to manage Windows Update for Business, either option can be configured without requiring any on-premises infrastructure by using Microsoft Intune.

You can use Delivery Optimization to reduce bandwidth consumption by sharing the work of downloading these packages among multiple devices in your deployment.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/waas-overview#servicing-tools
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/waas-delivery-optimization
Azure gpo uses intune

Config Manager - Create collections and then push updates as and when needed. 
GPO - Path to Config manager via policy
Delivery Optimization - Windows 10 feature

comments.content: Where are you installing Config Manager? There is no server.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have 100 computers that run Windows 10. You have no servers. All the computers are joined to Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
The computers have different update settings, and some computers are configured for manual updates.
You need to configure Windows Update. The solution must meet the following requirements:
✑ The configuration must be managed from a central location.
✑ Internet traffic must be minimized.
✑ Costs must be minimized.
How should you configure Windows Update? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: I think it is D - modify the computer to add the domain name

comments.content: following this advice is the easiest way to fail this exam

discussion.content: When answers are not clear in discussion, stick with the dump's answer.

The correct answer is D. Modify the Computer setting in the filter.

Since the event is logged on a computer named LON-SVR1 and not on LON-CL1, the event does not appear in View1. To ensure that the event appears in View1, we need to modify the Computer setting in

Selected Answer: D
You have to use FQDN

Selected Answer: D
I have also tested it in my lab. When the computer is domain joined it needs FQDN.
Need to add envent id 10010 in filter
Just tested, Answer is D.

The "Task category" is only available to filter a log once you've already selected something for "Event sources" above that in the "Filter Current Log" dialog. On the question, the filter setting doesn't indicate the "Event Source". So for me the answer for this is D.

The answer is D. Tested on a domain joined computer. You have to use FQDN, which includes the domain name. If you look at the question it only indicates the computer name without the domain in the "computer" name. This returns 0 results in filtered view.

Just tested this out and the answer is D you need to change the computername into FQDN.
so also add adantum.com to the computername filter.
IS CORRECT Add a Task Category setting to the filter.
IS CORRECT

comments.content: Yes it is: D. Modify the Computer setting in the filter.
I'm tested it. Add domain to the computer name and all events will be showing.

discussion.content: But how are you add Task category to the filter? It's or inactive, or can't be specified.

choices.A: Add a Task Category setting to the filter.
choices.B: Add the computer account to the Event Log Readers group.
choices.D: Modify the Computer setting in the filter.

questions.question_text:
You have a computer named LON-CL1.Adatum.com that runs Windows 10.
From Event Viewer, you create a custom view named View1 that has the following filter:
✑ User: User1
✑ Logged: Any time
✑ Event logs: System
✑ Computer: LON-CL1
✑ Event IDs: 10000 `" 11000
✑ Event level: Error, Verbose
You open Event Viewer and discover the event shown in the exhibit. (Click the Exhibit tab.)
//IMG//

The event does not appear in View1.
You need to ensure that the event appears in View1.
What should you do?

You have a computer named Computer1 that runs Windows 10 and has an application named App1.
You need to use Performance Monitor to collect data about the processor utilization of App1.
Which performance object should you monitor?

discussion.content: Actually, I think this needs to be A. Process. If I open Perfomance monitor and select 'Process' from the available counters, it lets mee select and running application at the 'Instances of the selected object' windows. Once added, the processor time is available to monitor.

Performance Monitor/Performance Monitor/Add/Process 
Thats what I think.

This answer tells you what you need.
https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/windows/en-US/42afb7cd-6cb6-463c-b385-21a97162e3f5/monitoring-cpu-usage-of-individual-processes?forum=winservergen

The answer is A, Process. Try it yourself in the Lab, when you want to find the Performance data of a specific application you have to choose process -> choose process -> then select the counters you care about.

it's A) process. 

Open Performance Monitor. Click "add" (cross symbol)
Under Process you find %Processor Time
Then you can select e.g. PowerPoint and you see....
It ask for the App1 info, which under process, it monitors running application program and system processes
This is wrong on win 10 platform it is in processor information that you can see the utilisation

comments.content:
100 % - A is the correct answer - For example if the App you are looking at is OneDrive. Open Perfmon then , click on Green Plus sign , then browse to the available counters - you will see Process, Processor Information and Processor Performance. The questions asks for App1 so in the example if you look Process you will see all the Apps on your laptop -eg One drive .
Question is now asking about Processor Information - its about the App.

questions.question_text:
You have a computer that runs Windows 10 and has File History enabled. File History is configured to save copies of files every 15 minutes.
At 07:55, you create a file named D:\Folder1\File1.docx.
You add D:\Folder1 to File History and manually run File History at 08:00.
You modify File1.docx at the following times:
✑ 08:05
✑ 08:12
08:20
//IMG//

✑ 08:24
✑ 08:50
At 08:55, you attempt to restore File1.docx.
How many previous versions of File1.docx will be available to restore?

discussion.content:
The previous versions of File1.docx would be as follows:

Version 1: Created at 07:55
Version 2: Created at 08:00
Version 3: Created at 08:15 (includes changes made at 8:05 and 8:12)
Version 4: Created at 08:30 (includes changes made at 8:20 and 8:24)
The changes made to File1.docx at 08:50 would not be saved until 09:00, so there would be no version created for that time.

Therefore, there would be 4 previous versions of File1.docx available to restore at 09:00.

Selected Answer: B
B is definitely the correct one. No doubts here.

File History behavior:
1 - File History runs every 15 minutes even if there are no changes.
2 - As there are no changes, nothing will be saved.
3 - File History runs every 15 minutes from the last save, not the time it was activated.

The backup runs 4 times and SAVES COPIES 3 times.

08:00 runs manually and saves a new copy of the file
Modifications (08:05 and 08:12)
08:15 runs and saves
modifications (08:20 and 08:24)
08:30 runs and saves
no modifications
08:45 runs but doesn't do anything
modification (08:50)
“At 08:55, you attempt to restore File1.docx.”

comments.content:
There is a fourth behavior:
4 - If you run a manual save, File History starts timing again from this manual hit.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
8:00 -> 1st backup of file
8:15 -> 2nd backup of file
8:30 -> 3rd backup of file
8:45 -> No backup , because no changes happened.

It seems a previous bug in early versions of W10, when File History was creating new backups every time, even files were not changed. This also happens when using non-NTFS (source)drives where USN is not available. But normally, File History will only create new backups of changed files.

comments.content: "You add D:\Folder1 to File History and manually run File History at 08:00."

discussion.content:
Answer is 3.
File create at 7.55 - 
First backup at 8.
File modified at 8.05 and 8.12 
2nd backup @ 8.15
File modified at 8.20 and 8.24
3rd backup at 8.30
No changes 
3rd backup 8.45 is the same as 8.30 as no file versions change

comments.content:
Are you sure? Backups run every 15 minutes, wouldn't it be:
8:00 first Backup (manual and file history)
08:15 second Backup
08:30 Third backup
08:45 Fourth backup

There was no modification after 8:30, so the 8:45 backup didn't create a new file. So the file changed at 8:50 didn't have a backup. The last version available is 8:24 from the THIRD backup. So the answer is 3.

discussion.content:
Backup runs at:
8:00 -> 1st backup of file
8:15 -> 2nd backup of file
8:30 -> 3rd backup of file
8:45 -> No newer version of file available

Answer must be 3.

comments.content: Wrong. They are INCREMENTAL backups, not FULL. So, no change, no backup. There was no change between 8:30 and 8:45. The answer is 3.

discussion.content:
available versions:
1. 8:00
2. 8:15
3. 8:30
4. 8:45
Thuis should be 3.
